intro: Dianthus geticus, commonly known as the common carnation, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky areas. The flowers are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and fragrance.
